title: Lane, Yanks agree to Minor League deal
subtitle: Lane, Yanks agree to Minor League deal
body: NEW YORK -- Outfielder Jason Lane and the Yankees have agreed to a Minor League contract.  The 31-year-old Lane hit .175 with eight home runs and 27 RBIs in 171 at-bats for Houston and San Diego last season. He hit a career-high 26 homers in 2005 with Houston, when he batted .267 and had 78 RBIs.  Yankees general manager Brian Cashman announced the agreement Thursday on the YES Network.
